value:
When Prince Lyon and his mages,
after great effort, finally produced
the Dark Stone, everything changed.

Emperor Vigarde was a wise man
with a good heart, celebrated as
the Silent Emperor...$k$pFor him to suffer the fate he did
is too terrible to bear.

When I tossed my honor aside and
turned traitor to the empire, I knew
what was coming for me.$k$pI hoped only that His Majesty would
rediscover the kindness I once knew.

I've trained with just about anything
you can call a weapon.$k$pPrince Ephraim may hold my lance
prowess in high esteem, but I think
of myself as a jack-of-all-blades.

I have no objection to being branded
a traitor. I regret only turning on the
empire and, despite it all, His Majesty.

I see. So you're a summoner, just
like $Nf.$k$pThere really is no telling from
appearance alone, is there?

Any who face me had better have
their affairs in order!

The strength of Obsidian has not
waned since His Majesty, Emperor
Vigarde, bestowed the honor on me.

I will muster every last ounce of my
strength to serve what remains of
Grado and its people.

You ought to favor those with more
youthful vigor, eager to grow...
Nevertheless, you have my thanks.

I am Duessel the Obsidian of the
Imperial Three—or rather, that is who
I once was. Now I am just an old man.

As a warrior, it is when I am closest
to death that I feel most alive. Fate's
sense of humor, I suppose.$k$pWhen the evil of the Dark Stone
gripped Grado, I lost my honor,
everything—I was a hollow shell.$k$pPerhaps I should have remained and
followed the orders of my emperor.$k$pI could have died for Grado and
avoided the shame that followed
my betrayal.$k$pBut how can I sit by as the young—
Prince Ephraim, Glen, Cormag,
Selena, Prince Lyon—risk their lives.$k$pI will fight to my last breath for the
young warriors marching to war to
defend their countries.$k$pMy final wish is for a new Grado
to be founded, and I will bear that
weight however I must.
はあっ
甘いな
ぐうっ
いかん…！
I've still got it!
I won't stagger!
I must follow my convictions!
I'm not finished yet!
I have fulfilled my service.
Hmph.
I am Duessel. I was once the obsidian general of the Grado Empire, but cirumstances demand I turn my back on my home.
I haven't seen a soldier show guts like that in a long time. Good on you. Haha!
As a warrior, I take pride in improving my skills and passing them on to willing students.
Ephraim has grown strong. There's nothing left for me to teach him, it seems.
This lance is one of the last weapons forged by Gavaleus. It is my pride and joy. Care for a closer look?
Surely, Cormag will be able to tame that cursed lance once and for all...
I'll keep a good eye out for you. Command me without worry.
By your will.
A daring plan.
Victory is in sight.
